item.title: How To Make a Net DIY
item.dc:creator: Neil Mahaseth
item.description:
Hi friends in this video I will show you how I created a net using polyethylene or nylon rope for my gardening needs. This will be a detailed step-by-step DIY...

The post How To Make a Net DIY appeared first on Plants My Love.
item.content:encoded:
Hi friends in this video I will show you how I created a net using polyethylene or nylon rope for my gardening needs. This will be a detailed step-by-step DIY project so make sure to watch through the complete video. The benefit of making your own net is you can customize the dimension and the mesh size depending on your needs.

▼Scan @ Video Index▼

  • 00:00 Intro
  • 0:15 Uses for Plastic Net
  • 0:39 Things Required
  • 1:40 Tying the Horizontal Thread
  • 1:54 Calculating Length of Thread
  • 3:16 Attaching Vertical Strings
  • 4:20 Cutting Vertical Strings
  • 4:41 Tying Vertical Strings
  • 5:19 Spacing Vertical Strings
  • 6:28 Tightening Vertical Strings
  • 7:38 Creating the Diamond Pattern
  • 9:50 Final Look of the Net
  • 10:32 Tying Botton of the Net

I hope friends, you liked this video guide on How To Make a Net DIY. If yes, don’t forget to share this video with your friends and family whom you think could benefit from it. If you liked this, you might also like our other gardening-related content. Make sure to subscribe to our YouTube channel or join our mailing list to be alerted as soon as a new video is released. Thanks for watching friends see you later bye.

item.title: Rainy Season Vegetable Terrace Garden Tour
item.dc:creator: Neil Mahaseth
item.description:
Hi friends in this video I will take you on a tour of my terrace vegetable garden. We will see plants like lemongrass, mint, okra (ladies finger), eggplant (brinjal), chilies...

The post Rainy Season Vegetable Terrace Garden Tour appeared first on Plants My Love.
item.content:encoded:
Hi friends in this video I will take you on a tour of my terrace vegetable garden. We will see plants like lemongrass, mint, okra (ladies finger), eggplant (brinjal), chilies (hot peppers), and cherry tomato. This is a new video format an impromptu vlog-style hopefully you all will like it. Stay tuned for more videos.
